gangs,
Here's the " can you handle the truth " version of the Tampa show
..=
............

location...........great, no hassle about airport transportat=
ion etc. 
etc.
but you all know that already.

Weather......... great the f=
irst day, second day it freaking rained 
on us !!
It's fun to see all the o=
ld timers smoke chimneys huddled under the 
stairwell
by the pool cracking =
old jokes.
Last day it's cold and the eastern seaboard states are all snowe=
d
in............... have fun, boys from the east getting home on time.


ev=
ents.............  Jim's lecture and exhibition of Akasaka tsuba is 
greaaa=
tttttttttttt ( quoting Tony the tiger, god bless his soul ).The 
NBTHK over=
sea branch exhitbition of swords and kantei ( open to all ) 
is excellent. =
I did not attempt the kantei as I don't want to 
embarrass myself even thou=
gh i would hit one right on ( the owner 
told me  his juyo Ko-Mihara would =
be there ). Then there's the 
oshigata lesson, the demonstration of the cla=
y thingie on swords ( 
hey, i am more of a fitting guy, can't recall the pr=
oper sword term 
anymore ) etc......

 Buying and selling................. =
buyers' market, no question 
about it !!
If you carry cash and ready to par=
t with them, great bargains 
everywhere !!
Problem is most are freaking che=
ap................ or they all drop 
their loads
by Hagrid's ( aka the big =
guy Mark walberg ) table who has boxes and 
boxes ( I kid you
not ) of kodo=
gu of the highest calibre ( and the price , though high, 
is
reasonable ).
=
Mantis dude, i took a pic of a mantis tsuba from Hagrid's table just 
for
y=
ou...............I think the asking price is in the mid 2k.
I personally ma=
rked my tsuba below retail and managed to sell only 
two tsuba
in the highe=
r mid range level and traded away a bunch of low end 
tsuba for
somethings =
I can live with. So i consider the show as " slow " but I 
do know
a friend=
 sold a few high end tsuba so the show is good in his 
prospective.

Foods.=
.................. the exhibitor's dinner on Saturday can only 
be
describe=
d as " strange ".............
I wonder how our dear friends from Deustchlan=
d enjoyed the true " 
southern
cooking " that include black eye peas und co=
llar greens !!??

Jss/us business................ at least 10 new collector=
s signed up 
as new
members at the show all due to the effort of one diecto=
r from Canada 
( in
matters of hours ) !!
The society will be publishing Yo=
shikawa Sensei's writing ( 
translated by
Prof. Gordon Robson ) in 3 volume=
s all priced at cost !!
An excellent article by our John Berta on Onin tsub=
a will be 
published in
the upcoming journal, on top of that out dear frien=
d from Deustchland 
Hans has
, most generously , gave us permission to repr=
int his article on Yagyu
tsuba. Considered what he ate on Saturday night, I=
 wondered how he 
can still
be
so nice..............may be it's because I p=
ersonally asked him ? Or 
may be he
had private dinner with carl who told m=
e he had lobster with wine 
sauce
prepared just for him at the hotel ?? Arr=
rrrrrrrrhhhhhhhhhh, life is
soooooooooooo unfair !!

that's about all I can=
 think about just now.
For the " serious version " of the event, wait for t=
he Ombudsman's 
report.

p.s. also learned a new trick from one of the old =
timer...... when 
checking Goto school kozuka, run your finger nail under t=
he "
